content: merry little heart merry little heart © heidi kirrmaier page 1 of 5 december 1 2023 finished size 4 5 cm 1¾ inches high and 5 5 cm 2¼ inches at widest point this may vary with yarn choice and needle size materials & tools approximately 1 25 m or yards of dk or sport weight yarn any other yarn weight may be used and will affect resulting size white samples shown are knit in brooklyn tweed arbor 100% targhee wool 133 m / 50 g colour thaw and blue samples are knit in de rerum natura ulysse 100% merino wool 185 m / 50 g colour nuit circular or straight needles 2-3 sizes smaller than you would normally use with your yarn this ensures you get a dense fabric and a heart that holds its shape dk and sport weight samples shown were knit with 2 25 mm us 1 needles 1 stitch marker 1 removable marker small tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge 30 sts and 60 row per 10 cm 4 inches in garter st gauge is not critical and may differ if you are using lighter or heavier yarn notes heart is knit from the bottom point up once the center diamond is complete a semi-circle is worked on each side to complete the heart shape there are 2 methods for making increases for the diamond and 2 methods for finishing the top edges of the semi-circles choose whichever you like abbreviations are on page 5 pattern support please post any questions you may have in heidi kirrmaier s ravelry group here https //www ravelry com/groups/heidi-kirrmaier if you don t have a ravelry account email questions to heidikdesigns411@gmail com share please tag your projects with #merrylittleheart and #heidikdesigns on social media thanks merry little heart © heidi kirrmaier page 2 of 5 december 1 2023 instructions 1 bottom of heart diamond backward loop co 2 sts tip this can be done without making a slip knot first refer to photos on page 5 row 1 rs kfb kfb = 4 sts tip pull on tail to tighten co sts if necessary row 2 ws slip 1 k3 whenever the instructions indicate slip 1 hold yarn in front and slip the st as if to purl method 1 this method makes a neat centered spine but may be difficult to work at a tight gauge especially if your yarn has little elasticity m1l is worked as usual then m1r is also worked as usual using the same strand between the needles that was used for m1l this means 2 new sts are knit from the same lifted strand row 3 rs slip 1 k1 m1l m1r k2 = 6 sts tip place removable marker on rs of work to help keep track of which row you re working on row 4 ws slip 1 k5 row 5 rs slip 1 k2 m1l m1r k to end = 8 sts row 6 ws slip 1 k to
